citeinfo.origin: Land Use Secretariat, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: LUF Integrated Regional Plan Boundaries

pubinfo.publish: Land Use Secretariat, Government of Alberta

descript.abstract: The Government of Alberta has established seven land-use regions and is developing a regional plan for each region. As set out in the provincial Land-use Framework the regional boundaries are based upon watersheds and adjusted to align with municipal boundaries. Regional plans will integrate provincial policies at the regional level; set out regional land-use objectives and provide the context for future land-use decisions that reflect the uniqueness and priorities of the region within a provincial policy context. Municipalities and provincial departments and agencies will be required to comply with the directions in the regional plan in their decision-making once the plan is completed.
descript.purpose: This polygon shapefile contains the seven Land-use Framework regions which have been updated match the legal descriptions that have been prepared for Order-in-Councils. This shapefile is intended to replace the existing Base Features GeoAdministration Land-use Framework polygon shapefile that was produced by Alberta Sustainable Resource Development, Resource Information Management Branch 2008-11-24.
descript.supplinf: This Land-use Framework Integrated Regional Plan Boundary polygon shapefile is intended to replace the existing Base Features GeoAdministration Land-use Framework polygon shapefile that was produced by Alberta Sustainable Resource Development, Resource Information Management Branch 2008-11-24.

idinfo.useconst: This material has been provided with the intent that it be readily available for personal and public non-commercial (educational) use and except where otherwise prohibited, may be reproduced, in part or in whole and by any means, without charge or further permission from the Land Use Secretariat We only ask that: . The materials not be modified. . Users exercise due diligence in ensuring the accuracy of the materials. . The Government of Alberta be identified as the source of the materials. . The reproduction is not represented as an official version of the materials reproduced, nor as having been made in affiliation with or with the endorsement of the Government of Alberta. . Reproduction of multiple copies of materials, in whole or in part, for the purposes of commercial distribution is prohibited, except with written permission from the Land Use Secretariat. To obtain permission to reproduce materials on this site for commercial purposes, please contact the Land Use Secretariat
